name: The Imperial Hotel

reviews.title: first class service
reviews.text: My wife and i booked a [romantic weekend offer] at the Imperial to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We have been to the hotel once before, a couple of years ago,but were realy impressed by the inprovements.

reviews.title: a different side to blackpool
reviews.text: The room we were allocated had been refurbished to a high standard whilst retaining the original features. i.e. coving and windows etc.

reviews.title: Wonderful short break
reviews.text: The food in the restaurant was excellent, but most impressive was the service from the staff at all levels thruought the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard of service in at reception, in the bar,and roomservice was helpful and friendly but in the restaurant ,outstanding. They made our stay quite special .
reviews.title: great experience at The Imperial Hotel Blackpool
FAB AND CARING
reviews.text: We will certainly be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights during a recent visit to Delhi on our way to a friend's wedding in Jodhpur. The hotel is amazing. Easily one of the top three hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were spacious and the inlaid marble floors were marvelous! The hotel staff was great - there was always someone around to answer a question or get whatever you needed. The spa was great as well. We had excellent treatments during our visit. We enjoyed the history (it felt like we stepped back in time) and artwork throughout the hotel. The breakfast was top notch as well. Between the service, the amazing marble floors and the history, you won't find a better place in Delhi.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit nervous of our first trip to India and wanted a lovely first experience. Wow did we get it.
reviews.title: Delhi magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Imperial is an art deco building and decorated in the art deco style in the heart of New Delhi. Would not be surprised to see Poirot coming down the corridor. This may be the loveliest hotel we have stayed in anywhere. It is not stuffy; instead we felt like a member of an extended family.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: The building is architecturally interesting and beautifully decorated with antiques and old prints. The staff is helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is a treat including three types of the hotel's own honey.
reviews.title: Luxury...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and faced a courtyard and was quiet. We had a very comfortable bed, a modern bathroom.
reviews.title: As good as it gets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel MUST be first on my list of the best Hotel I have ever stayed in. From the food, the service, friendliness of staff, luxurious rooms, check in check out. Quality and up keep of the facility. Absolutely nothing to criticize.I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Delhi.
reviews.title: It must the best I have ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay here for our last 3/2 nights days in Delhi after 5w in India. We are so glad we did. It is a haven. After 5 weeks travelling Northern India and using budget accommodation we were looking for a quiet place to recuperate and rest. We arrived looking dishevelled and without booking, but were received very warmly at reception. A good sign. Staff could not have been more helpful or hospitable. This is a luxury hotel at the high end of the market but it represents excellent value. The hotel has a sense of history and continuity. It is superbly maintained and shows no sign of wear and tear, no easy task in India. It has outstanding facilities, restaurants, and outdoor areas. Staff have a sense of pride in their jobs and an obvious pride of the hotel. Indeed, this is a proud hotel. At a special Diwali celebration we were meet by the hotel vice-president and general manager, who made us very welcome. This is a large luxury hotel that still maintains the personal touch. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: memorable experience

reviews.text: Entering the hotel lobby you immediately find a sign where the smoking area is. “The Smoke House” is located near 1911, which is an open-air restaurant. The only location light up a cigarette. India has a smoking ban in restaurants smoking in open areas however is allowed. Delhi city ranks second of the highest air pollution in the world. The heaven is invisible so yellow the air is. In the Imperial we paid US$ 780 for a double room and were send in a coop for smoking, worst than in any airport! Sometimes it was so overcrowded, non one couldn’t enter anymore. We would have been preferred seeing a sign indicating that a percentage of our hotel bill is going to the deserving poor we saw so many around.
reviews.title: Imperial smoking ban

reviews.text: Whatever your opinion about smoking is, in this environment a smoking ban is ridiculous!
reviews.title: Oasis in Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Imperial Hotel is an oasis in the hussle bussle of Delhi. Comfortable elegant rooms. Very good service. Enjoyed dining in the various restaurants and afternoon tea on the lawns. Lovely pool. Highly recommend for business or leisure.
reviews.title: Extraordinarily helpful in dealing with problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely art-deco buildings set in spacious grounds and in a very central location (slightly impeded at the moment by works on the metro line). Broad expanses of corridor house an art history of empire worthy of any museum in the world. Punctilious from the first greeting, front-of house staff, room service and housekeping are all they should be and recall more gracious times. Our "Heritage" room was spacious and stylish and incorporated all modern amenities in a period setting. We enjoyed both restaurants and an elegant lunch on the terrace. A delight to stay there. However, prices are high and, while we felt they represented value for money, others might disagree.
reviews.title: Imperial Echoes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it really was his former residence he must have had a wonderful life and a big family...
reviews.title: The former residence of the Viceroy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, impressive without being a stuffed shirt. From the greeting to the farewell we had a wonderful stay. Initially stayed in a Heritage Room which was very comfortable. It seemed a fair walk from the foyer but it never seemed a problem as the walk through the halls with all the fabulous old prints was always interesting.
reviews.title: Imperial Splendour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our return, I had booked a Grand Heritage room but they upgraded us to a Deco suite which was a lovely set of rooms and an excellent example of art deco. A bit of a brickbat for some mechanical noise all night - subdued but annoying. May have been from the roof or outside of the hotel so cant be too censorious.
reviews.title: Great place to stay when you first arrive into India

reviews.text: Food and Drink - the 1911 bar was fabulous as was the restaurant overlooking the garden. Food was excellent. Prices for food were good for what you got. $25 for a glass of run of the mill chablis was stretching it a bit.
reviews.title: A touch of Imperial elegance in Delhi
Luxury weekend-I dont think so.
reviews.text: What a shame to see this one time beautiful hotel reduced to a very second rate guest house. The only positive thing I can say about it was that the staff were very helpful and friendly. We had booked in at the Imperial for a weekend to enjoy a little bit of gracious living???? We stayed here a few years ago and really enjoyed our stay. We were given room 348 and the smell by the Saturday night was dreadful - apparently we were over the kitchen. One of the staff who kindly sprayed the room for us and gave us a large fan nearly gagged when he came in. As the hotel was full there were no other rooms available for us,and as the smell was only really bad by the saturday and we were leaving on the sunday morning we did not want the nuisance of packing up all our things just for twelve hours. The food was ok but breakfast on the saturday morning was very disorganised as everyone seemed to come down at 9am and the queues for the tables were massive. There were not enough staff on to get the tables cleared and set up again. The other thing that annoyed me was that the hotel clearly stipulated on their booking form that they did not allow any single sex parties-what a joke! There were at least three big parties of women only. One of these parties were in rooms opposite and ajoining ours and the noise when they eventually came to bed I will leave to your imagination. The ensuite to our bedroom was clean but extremely narrow where the toilet was and I would defy any woman sized 20 or more to actually be able to sit on it.
Booked one night in October for the illuminations and to take advantage of a family get together. We were really looking forward to our break.
reviews.title: Illuminated by the Illuminations

likes.disliked: — Size of Rooms, Staff timekeeping and Lack of understanding of requirements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Called the hotel to confirm that 2pm check in was the norm and this was confirmed. On arrival, was told that the room should be ready for 3pm. At 3pm, was told the room should be ready at 4pm. At 4pm, we kicked off and were assigned a suite immediately.
reviews.title: So much potential - but ruined by details

likes.disliked: — Windows, lack of attention to detail

reviews.text: During that time, we'd been entertaining a 4yr old and 2yr old as best we could in a hotel lobby - not an enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms we were allocated, even though we'd booked sea front ended up being internal facing - not happy. The beds were tiny, and I mean tidy. I'm 6'1" and the bottom off my bed ran out half way down my shins. Width ? arm tip to tip - and thats a double! Ended up frequenting the hotel bar until 1am avoiding the envitable. Result ? Wife stuck in the room - not happy ! :)
reviews.title: Lovely Ornate Hotel - Great Service, Great Food

likes.liked: — Very spacious room, very friendly staff and good food.
likes.disliked: — Some windows needed replacing and let in drafts. Our Bathroom was cold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed yere twice: 2 Days at the start and again at the end of our vacation. Good quaility fittings and furnishings and plenty of experienced staff. Restaurants were good, but food and drink was eyewateringly expensive.
reviews.title: An established luxury hotel with a high opinion of the quality of its own services

reviews.text: However, on our return to Delhi, having stayed in other luxury hotels the staff felt arrogant - as if i should thank them for being there. A big contrast from some other hotels we stayed in. where the service was among the best I have ever seen: prompt, unobtrusive, efficient and with a smile.
reviews.title: WOW
Best Hotel
reviews.text: On both visits there were "events" on the lawn outsife the 1911 Bar/Resataurant (an conference and then a wedding) which made using the restaurant oppressive to the extent we had to move to another restaurant..
Also I really object to having to pay anything for internet access - especially exhorbitant rates for low band width access where the connection keeps falling over.
reviews.title: Must stay here at least once
Great location, amazing service and character
reviews.text: So - a good luxury hotel with excellent facilities - one whcih i would go back to - but it is not as good as it likes to think itself!

My husband and I stayed at the Imperial for six weeks (sept/oct 2010) and could not have imagined staying at a more welcoming, more comfortable, more accommodating hotel. The management and staff continually went beyond the expected and made our stay the most enjoyable time we have ever had at a hotel. The building is regal, the decor fabulous-one could spend hours looking at the artwork hung throughout the hotel. Of course the hotel has thought to offer guided tours of the hotel's collection.
reviews.title: If you want to be treated like royalty stay at the Imperial.

reviews.text: The substantial pool is a real treat and gorgeous. The hotel will soon have one of the regions best spas and a new fitness centre.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.text: The breakfast selections were extensive, fresh and beautifully displayed and prepared. The hotel has several high quality restaurants. We were never disappointed with our meals and we ate in the hotel often. This is a special hotel.
reviews.title: The Museum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has some breath taking interiors. It is centrally located with all shopping points and restaurants nearby. The morning breakfast buffet is something special. The staff services is completely satisfying. Definitely a thumbs up.
reviews.title: Old Colonial Charm at its best

reviews.text: This is something out of this world.
reviews.title: Imperial Style - Superior opulence and service

reviews.text: A grand hotel, but service quality not on par with competitors. Bed was springy and not comfortable. Rooms have tiny windows (design of hotel) - feels a bit claustrophobic. Food was ok, but nothing to rave about. Service in the 1911 restaurant was really bad on all 3 days i went there. Great spa though. Overall not worth the astronomical prices. ITC Maurya or the Hyatt are significantly better value for money.
reviews.title: A bit faded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warm welcome on arrival, and given a room upgrade. Wonderful room, however it was situated next door to the venue for a wedding. The noise from the wedding guests and the caterers who were working just outside our window was ubacceptable and on complaining we were moved to a suite for the rest of our stay. Despite this my wife and I cannot recommend this hotel more highly. The food in all of the restaurants was excellent as was the service. A visit to the Patiala Peg for an aperitif is a must. Situated in central Delhi, another plus.
reviews.title: Memories of colonial India

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been wanting to stay at this hotel since 2004 and perhaps my high expectations had got the better of me. We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated in a colonial style. There was a very comfortable huge bed. After taking in the wonderful decor of the room the noise from the outside metro work caught my attention but the lady that showed us the room guaranteed it would stop in the evening and not cause us any problem during the night. Unfortunately that guarantee didn't hold any weight. In the very early hours of the morning We were woken by the sound of heavy machinery and a very noisy digger. We did complain the next morning and asked to move room which was finally done with minimal inconvenience. Breakfast is fantastic and you can pretty much have whatever you can think of. From the breakfast room you can sit outside and have a lovely view of the garden but it had been blocked off with a marquee due to a function. I find this very frustrating but it seems to happen in a lot of Indian hotels. We have eaten lunch and dinner here and tried every restaurant. The afternoon tea is brilliant and they replenish anything you want. Pool food is very good, they do a great lamb burger. The Italian has a lovely intimate setting however the slow cooked duck I ordered was very tough. The Indian restaurant appeared badly run and the service was very ad hock. I had ordered a second glass of wine and after chasing the order twice it finally came after we had finished our meal. The waiters seemed to be rushing around and it felt very un-relaxing. The food was very tasty though. Apparently it has been voted one of the top restaurants in the world by Conde Neste Traveller, which we were very surprised by.
reviews.title: A sprinkling of disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is well maintain but very small. The hotel offer complimentary yoga sessions in the morning which were ok. Outdoor pool area large and has many sun loungers. The pool water temperature was as warm as bath water which felt very strange not to be able to cool off.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best hotel in Delhi

reviews.text: All in all I still love this hotel and would return if the opportunity did arise.
reviews.title: Period hotel in the heart of the Capital

reviews.text: I would have marked this as excellent but it was let down by a shambles of a fire alarm in the early hours of the morning. It wasnt the fact that the alarm went off merely the handling thereon that let them down. They mustered everyone outside then called everyone back into the hotel to shout out room numbers!! thankfully there was no fire or we would have been in trouble - however we had the excitement of men in uniform and a free cuppa. All in all though the room was immaculate, the bathroom luxurious, the staff very friendly and the food scrumptious. The leisure facilities were A1 with a swimming pool, jaccuzzi, gym etc and were free to use even till 10pm. The hotel was quiet at night and very child friendly for a 4star. Would definately go again.
reviews.title: Genuine friendly staff, beautiful even with kids!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Imperial hotel for 4 nights (2 adults and 2 children). On arrival, the first thing that hits when you walk into the hotel is the stifling heat. At the best of times, I am quite a cold creature but the heat in the hotel and the room - even with the heat off was very uncomfortable. I found the hotel itself had a very oldy worldy feel to it and if you are into contempoary clean cut designs, stay well away from this hotel. Checking in and out was fine and the staff accomodated us with our early arrival and also let us keep our room on until the late afternoon on check out as we had a late flight. The staff were all very friendly and the rooms were clean and tidy - a little on the small side for a family room but we made do. The prices in the hotel were extortionate - I thought the prices in Dublin for a drink were expensive but it was little in comparison to what the Imperial hotel charges. Also, as we had 2 children with us that were in buggies, we found accessability very difficult. There were steps to get into the hotel which we had to lift the buggies up and down. The lift was small and only allowed 1 buggy in so there was a lot of coming and going on that front. Overall, we had our share of problems but it was more to do with the hotel and not the staff. One thing I would like to point out is that my sister and her family were staying in the hotel and she had booked a family room for 2 adults and 2 children (aged 12 and 13). She was allocated a double room with 2 camp beds and when she got it changed, at check out, the hotel charged her £40.00 per night. Needless to say, it was not a good experience for her but I will let her write her own review. It would take too long for me to write....
reviews.title: Would'nt be running back...

reviews.text: Booked this hotel threw the hotel website and found it to be cheaper than going threw a booking agency.
reviews.title: Facilities Excellent

reviews.text: Paid just under £100 for a family room 2x adults 2xchildren for one night, breakfast was included thankfully! The room was very nice but it had BIG bay windows .. which the children thought were fascinating.. (sheltered lifes) luckily though they had locks on them.
reviews.title: Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities were excellent :-) The swimming pool, Jacuzzi, and not to mention the steam room were very refreshing.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff - PERFECT

reviews.text: The Imperial is one of the oldest hotels in New Delhi and I loved the fact that it has it's own place in history.
reviews.title: It's like staying in a slice of history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is absolutely impeccable and the Spice Route restaurant is really good too.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My room was very large (considering the hotel's location) and the room was very well decorated. The bathroom had a big shower as well as a bath.
reviews.title: Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location is great and very close to all that Delhi has to offer.
reviews.title: Worst experience ever for $450/night

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 2013 , had a very enjoyable stay . Hotel is very well situated for all things to do and see in New Delhi .Hotel definitely has an old Colonial feel about it .
reviews.title: Downton abbey with great espresso
Hotel is still fabulous
reviews.text: I got very concerned about our stay at the Imperial, as I had heard from several people that the management of the hotel changed within the past year, and that standards had slipped. The previous manager of the Imperial is currently the manager of Raffles Singapore. So, I approached the Imperial with some trepidation. I was really pleasantly surprised. If the hotel was indeed better in years past, it must have been truly awesome, because it is a still a magnificentt place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is memorable. I think the hallways are really the best of any hotel that I have ever stayed in. Marble floors and walls lined with antique prints make going to your room a wonderful and interesting experience. I learned so much just looking at the hundreds of prints on the walls. And the rooms were quite beautiful as well, with spacious showers and nice toiletries (although NO hair conditioner...one of my pet peeves....)
reviews.title: Classic and Elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: True, our room had no view to speak of . The windows in the old part of the hotel are quite small, and as mentioned by another reviewer, there is extensive work going on one side of the Imperial. There are some shanty-type buildings outside, where workers do sleep. The hotel promised that the work would be quiet, and I would have to say that it was. And I didn't have any issues with privacy from the work area, although I was aware that there were people out there. There was extensive screening from the rooms, although this wasn't necessarily very attractive. All in all, I didn't find the work area to be an issue.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: After a hot day in Delhi, the Imperial's pool is quite a treat. I didn't notice fumes, as mentioned by one reviewer. There is a large generator overlooking the pool, that did make noise, but it wasn't a problem. The pool is huge with magnificent fountains and lovely gardens surrounding it. The pool is a memorable part of the Imperial experience.
reviews.title: Unforgettable experience with Imperial Delhi

reviews.text: We made extensive use of the cars and drivers at the hotel, and found them to be excellent. One of the drivers took us to Agra, and if you are familiar with Indian roads, you will know that this is quite a wild trip in some respects. In Agra, there is almost no adherence to any traffic laws. The Imperial's driver was great, and made us feel very safe in the midst of the lawlessness!
reviews.title: stylish and sophisticated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed at The Imperial Hotel to attend a friends wedding which was held at the Imperial. We searched on the net for the cheapest price and were quite impressed with the £125 bed and breakfasy rate we found. (every other website quoted £150 plus) Our first impressions of the hotel from the front were that it is in serious need of a makeover. The paint is shabby and tired looking and it didnt look impressive. We were given room number 342. Our view over looked a petrol station which had been knocked down and is now used as an unofficial taxi rank- lots of noise during the night. The iron in the room didnt work however the staff quickly brought us another one to our room. The room is very very small however it looked quite newly decorated. The bathroom was the smallest we had ever seen. No room at all to move about and you had to wedge yourself onto the toilet as the bath and the wall left you the smallest gap to get through. All in all i would not stay at this hotel again. Very overpriced however staff were pleasant and the breakfast was good. Make sure you get bed and Breakfast rate as otherwise its £15.95 er person.
reviews.title: VERY OVERPRICED!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in the Imperial and got the feeling that the hotel is living on it's past glories.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.disliked: — My request of a no smoking room was ignored

reviews.text: I specifically asked for a no smoking room and got allocated a smoking room. To be fair we were moved to better smelling room within a few minutes, however the bathroom was tiny which was a bit disappointing.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Grand hotel

likes.disliked: — Some restaurant staff, and limited set menu

reviews.text: The spa treatments I had were lovely and Simone did a great job pampering me.
reviews.title: ok but not at Christmas
Loved the Paramount Imperial, Blackpool
reviews.text: I agree with another reviewer around the prices in the bar - 2 cups of tea and a coke £6.50 ! Once we got the tea - I was orginally told in the bar that there was no tea. I did remind the barman that it was a hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I used Delhi as a hub for our various travels so we stayed at the Imperial twice. Yes it is expensive even by western standards but it is worth the price to get away from the chaos of India. We slept very soundly both the nights we stayed and we were even upgraded the second time we came back after being recognized by the same receptionist. Breakfast is extremely good and the staff even arranged to have complimentary breakfast with us at the room since we had to catch the train to Agra the second time.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we would definitely stay at the Imperial again if we ever came back to Delhi.
reviews.title: A beautiful trip back in time

reviews.text: It is what you need to get away from chaotic Delhi, beautifully decorated, large rooms (we had the heritage room) great service. A real imperial venue. To be tried the spice route, one of most renomated restaurant in the city. The spa is brand new, very nice as well with a service always customized on personal need.
reviews.title: Perfect in everyway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I missed my flight to Dharmasala so had to book a hotel quickly. Called for reservation from the airport was quoted $525 a night, I asked if they could do better and she came back in about 30seconds and said $365 for a the Eliza Suite. They took great care of me even called my other hotel to tell them I missed my flight and would be arriving a day late. They arranged for a driver to show me around Delhi. Beds, Bathroom and room were perfect!!!
reviews.title: Great historical hotel ... could use service improvements

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed following my spending a couple of weeks in India on business. The hotel is pricey. The building and its contents are lovely and very historical. The location is good, right on the Janpath and next to the Janpath Market. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from Connaught Place. The car service to the airport is very expensive (about $70 US) but if you don't have much luggage, use the hotel's taxi service which runs at a fraction. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good, we also had room service and it was equally good.
reviews.title: Class, elegance and incredible service.

reviews.text: Great hotel, impeccable decor and beautiful rooms. Staff are all excellent, friendly and efficient. Have stayed 6 times in past year and it gets better. Gym could be better. Pool is excellent as is location.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, best staff & service - always

reviews.text: Lovely lovely hotel, everything about it was amazing. I think the pool was my favorite part-amazing saline pool, really amazing. The rooms, service and decor hotelwide was such a treat and the brunch was out of this world. Totally a decadent treat to be able to stay here. The location was great, just down the block from CP and across the street from the cottage industry emporium. Great shopping. I loved Delhi a beautiful city, well planned out and full of sights, sounds and shopping delights. I loved the whole experience. Cannot wait to go back.
reviews.title: nicest hotel I have every stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed at this hotel a few months ago and were quite disappointed with the level of service both at check-in and breakfast. The hotel's common areas are beautiful and unique but somehow this does not make up for the aloof attitude of the staff. The waiters at breakfast were very slow and took more than 10 minutes to even hand out the menus and sometimes they did not even do so and we had to ask for the menus several times. We saw other guests complaining on this also. We regularly stay in five star hotels in India and around the world (Oberoi - where service is excellent), Taj, Park Hyatt, Ritz, Plaza Athenee etc) and for us this level of service is simply unacceptable . The rooms are ok except for the bathrooms which are not up to five star standard. The Spice restaurant was of a decent standard but was not up to expectations.
reviews.title: terrible service

reviews.text: This really is a beautiful hotel. The pubic areas are stunning and everywhere you go you can smell jasmine.
reviews.title: Gorgeous luxury hotel - highly recommended

reviews.text: We stayed on two separate occassions, once while we were on business and the second time on our return from a tour of the Golden Triangle which was organised through Castle and King Inc, based in New Delhi and they were excellent. It was Castle and King who recommended The Imperial to us.
reviews.title: Colonial Style!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best experience I've ever had in a big city. So quiet compare with the overexciting athmosphere of the street. And so luxury with one of the best Thai restaurant inside. Expensive like any other 5 stars luxury, but real great experience.
reviews.title: Amazing - Simply perfect

reviews.text: Please avoid this hotel; it is indeed a disgrace to the world luxury. Its very expensive in terms of internet, meal and room facilities--its got bad water from drying river Yamuna, not been filtered and part of feces were seen in the sink water. STD calls are way more expensive than what another hotel would charge. Staff is polite, but they are helpless. The walls are plastered with photos etc. claiming to be historical ones, however they are artificially produced and are misleading in character and its veracity. The meals are very very poor quality. Ordered Indian food, it was very poorly made and was tasteless, as the flour they used was not of good quality. Please avoid this place
reviews.title: disgrace to the word luxury

reviews.text: Stayed at The Imperial twice in 5 days. The first stay got upgraded to a Heritage Room which was spacious and well equipped... decent size bathroom. The second stay got an art deco room which was half of the size of Heritage Room... that's when all the problems started. First call was to fix the lukewarm water from the shower. Second call was for someone to get rid of the mosquitos flying around the room. They came in and sprayed insecticide into room which made the room smelled. So, overall, the experience at The Imperial was very uneven.
reviews.title: Solid hotel if you get upgraded rooms.

reviews.text: When you walk out the gate of the hotel to look at the shops on Jan Path road or go to the emporium handicraft house right across the road there will be rickshaw drivers hassling you and sending you deliberately in the wrong direction so they can get commission by "helping" you find the right store.
reviews.title: Watch out for touts when you leave the hotel on foot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ignore them and be firm. They can be quite overwhelming and even aggressive. If you can't shake them just shout out for one of the several guards standing at the gate of the hotel.
reviews.title: Poorly managed property with wasted potential

reviews.text: Prepare to take a trip back in time and enjoy delightful service and an amazing colonial decor. The hotel pays so much attention to detail, it really shows. Fresh flowers everywhere, and a nice scent with aromatic oils in all the hallways. Room incredibly comfortable and classy. Wide array of restaurants and bars, I had lunch at 1911, very good, and dinner at the Spice Route (for all the hype surrounding it, I wasn't too impressed). Only downside: it doesn't have a spa.
reviews.title: Classy and stylish - a true Jewel in the Crown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short: lovely, luxurious hotel, a real oasis.
reviews.title: oasis of calm but not while we were there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: luxury hotel in centre of delhi. Excellent service and wonderful art. Indian restaurant was superb, buffet breakfast OK. Our real problem was the development work outside our window. we had to change rooms in the middle of the night because of it. However, the hotel management acted quickly and efficiently to put things right
reviews.title: Great hotel, but here's some advice

reviews.text: I'm not going to bore you with details of how good this hotel, as everyone else have already done this for me. Instead here's a little bit of advice.
reviews.title: Truly excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Don't bother to book a hotel car through hotel reception. All the drivers will ferry you around privately (in luxury hotel cars) for half the price if asked (10 quid an hour)
reviews.title: Loved the property

description: The four-star Imperial Hotel Blackpool dominates the North Promenade and was one of the first hotels the Victorians built in the new seaside resort of Blackpool.Everything Blackpool has to offer is right on your doorstep and it’s a great base for exploring the surrounding region. Venture out to discover unspoilt beaches on the Fylde Coast and Cumbria’s picturesque lakes and mountains.This stunning Victorian Blackpool hotel boasts 180 modern bedrooms, 9 of which are stunning suites with sea views, it also has an indoor pool and the No.10 bar, which has served drinks to many British Prime Ministers.
